intro: Ubiaea schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its delicate, yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces small, hairy fruits that contain several seeds. Ubiaea schimperi is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its high-altitude habitat.
